text.p: TORONTO, Aug 8 Reuter) - The following are top headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
THE GLOBE AND MAIL: Ontario may cut pension share: Surpluses in public-sector plan may be used to reduce contribution, document says
-Report on abuse in hockey unveiled: Critics call study short on solutions
-Vancouver real estate loses lustre: As Hong Kong fever ebbs, rich Chinese head back across the Pacific
-South African peace at risk as Zulu leader linked to deaths: Buthelezi knew of hit-squad attacks on ANC, probe told
-Literary lion scares his prey away: Greg Gatenby, director of Toronto's International Festival of Authors at Harbourfront, demands wrtiters read only for him.
Business Section: Newcourt expands again: 'Watchout,' rivals told as Commcorp deal lifts lender to No.5 in its field in North America
-Vulture funds demand full Eaton payback: U.S. creditors threaten to put firm in bankruptcy by voting against restructuring unless debt paid 100 %
-Thomson executive quits on losing post: Paul passed over for CEO job
-Nova opens Santiago pipeline: Natural gas line marks first major foray into South America THE FINANCIAL POST: Newcourt
